agent_utterance: Tonight's ultra-simple plan: 1) Keep one portion-controlled snack nearby (e.g., 1 small yogurt with berries or a single protein bar). 2) Drink a glass of water or cold herbal tea. 3) Do a quick 2-minute box breathing and log one line: 'Snack chosen: yes; mood: _____' and place this log in a fixed spot. 4) If you feel a craving later, use: If stressed or hungry, then 2-minute breathing and a 1-line log. 5) Keep the snack and log together in the same spot to cut down on decision fatigue.

agent_utterance: Ultra-simple tonight: keep your main plan as you described—one portion-controlled snack (e.g., small yogurt with berries) plus a glass of water, the 2-minute box breathing, and log in the same spot. If craving hits in the evening, use this simple if-then: If craving, then breathe for 2 minutes and step outside for 5 minutes. If stepping outside isn’t comfortable due to heat, do a 5-minute indoor reset (gentle movement or a 5-4-3-2-1 grounding) and then log. Backup options (non-food): a quick 5-minute indoor walk or stretch; a cup of herbal tea or water; 5-4-3-2-1 grounding; or a small, easy-chore task to shift focus. Option B: add a tiny BED-friendly micro-snack as a separate, small item (1 small apple, 6–8 almonds, or 5–10 g dark chocolate) if the hunger persists.
